officialDesc: Porter College was founded in 1969 as the fifth of UC Santa Cruzâ€™s residential colleges and was later renamed in honor of a generous grant from the Porter-Sesnon family. Its mission is to foster achievement in all areas of study. Porter is especially dedicated to achievement in the arts, believing that creative inquiry is an essential part of a rigorous and broad-minded education, a flourishing society, and a happy life.
studentDesc: On the far west side of campus lies porter. Known for the Porter squiggle, Porter market, and the Koi pond, Porter is a destination for those wanting to enjoy the outdoors and get out of classrooms. It doesn't hurt that the individuals living in porter are actually pretty cool people.
